alert.note: Alert for Bullock; Macon (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 1:36PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Bullock and Macon Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 135 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hardaway, or 10 miles northwest of Union Springs, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tuskegee, Liverpool, Franklin Field, Lake Tuskegee, Hardaway, Tuskegee National Forest, Davisville, Society Hill, Warriorstand, I 85 Rest Area, Fort Davis, Cross Keys, Mitchell and Moton Field Municipal Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
